property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: U.S. service members near the Pakistan border

note.text: Afghanistan maintains a close relationship with Pakistan. The border with Pakistan was established in 1893. Called the Durand Line, this 1,500 mile stretch remains dangerous. Neither government fully controls the border region and it is a known area of refuge for al-Qaeda.
Pashtun tribal relationships on both sides of the border mean that the border is soft and porous. Both Pashtuns and Balochis benefit from smuggling across the border.
